Provide a direct characterization of the set $S$, where $S$ is the set of natural numbers defined inductively as follows:

a. 
    (1) $1\in S$
    
    (2) If $n\in S$, then $2n\in S$.

b. 
    1. $2\in S$

    2. If $n,m\in S$, then $n\times m\in S$.

c.  1. $\{n: n\textrm{ is prime}\}\subset S$. 

    2. If $n,m\in S$, then $n\times m\in S$.
